reporter.title: CORS misconfiguration allows credentialed cross-origin reads
reporter.summary: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.
steps_to_reproduce: Host malicious page and fetch protected endpoint with credentials.
Observe successful JSON read in attacker origin.

impact.description: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.

mitigation: Echo only trusted origins when credentials are allowed.
Disallow wildcard with credentials.

reporter.title: CSV injection in export enables formula execution
reporter.summary: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.
steps_to_reproduce: Create a record with a field value beginning with a formula string.
Export CSV and open in Excel/LibreOffice; observe formula execution.

impact.description: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.

mitigation: Escape cells starting with =,+,-,@ by prefixing a space or apostrophe.
Offer XLSX format by default.

reporter.title: SSRF via URL import fetch
reporter.summary: A server-side fetch accepts attacker-controlled URLs without allowlist or private range blocking, enabling access to internal metadata/services.
steps_to_reproduce: POST url=http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ to the import endpoint.
Observe internal metadata persisted in the created resource.

impact.description: A server-side fetch accepts attacker-controlled URLs without allowlist or private range blocking, enabling access to internal metadata/services.

mitigation: Allowlist destinations and deny link-local/private ranges.
Use an egress proxy with DNS pinning and strict timeouts.

reporter.title: SSRF via URL import fetch
reporter.summary: A server-side fetch accepts attacker-controlled URLs without allowlist or private range blocking, enabling access to internal metadata/services.
steps_to_reproduce: POST url=http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ to the import endpoint.
Observe internal metadata persisted in the created resource.

impact.description: A server-side fetch accepts attacker-controlled URLs without allowlist or private range blocking, enabling access to internal metadata/services.

mitigation: Allowlist destinations and deny link-local/private ranges.
Use an egress proxy with DNS pinning and strict timeouts.

reporter.title: CORS misconfiguration allows credentialed cross-origin reads
reporter.summary: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.
steps_to_reproduce: Host malicious page and fetch protected endpoint with credentials.
Observe successful JSON read in attacker origin.

impact.description: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.

mitigation: Echo only trusted origins when credentials are allowed.
Disallow wildcard with credentials.

reporter.title: Stored XSS in admin-facing render path
reporter.summary: User-provided content is persisted and rendered via an unsafe primitive in an admin-facing view, leading to JavaScript execution in a privileged context.
steps_to_reproduce: Create object with payload in a display field (e.g., subject/memo).
Open the admin list/detail view and observe execution.

impact.description: User-provided content is persisted and rendered via an unsafe primitive in an admin-facing view, leading to JavaScript execution in a privileged context.

mitigation: HTML-encode untrusted data before DOM insertion.
Adopt strict CSP and remove inline/event handlers.

reporter.title: CSV injection in export enables formula execution
reporter.summary: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.
steps_to_reproduce: Create a record with a field value beginning with a formula string.

impact.description: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.

mitigation: Escape cells starting with =,+,-,@ by prefixing a space or apostrophe.
Offer XLSX format by default.

reporter.summary: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.

reporter.summary: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.
steps_to_reproduce: Host malicious page and fetch protected endpoint with credentials.
Observe successful JSON read in attacker origin.

impact.description: The API returns Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * with Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true, allowing any origin to read responses with cookies.

mitigation: Echo only trusted origins when credentials are allowed.
Disallow wildcard with credentials.

reporter.title: Stored XSS in admin-facing render path
reporter.summary: User-provided content is persisted and rendered via an unsafe primitive in an admin-facing view, leading to JavaScript execution in a privileged context.
steps_to_reproduce: Create object with payload in a display field (e.g., subject/memo).
Open the admin list/detail view and observe execution.

impact.description: User-provided content is persisted and rendered via an unsafe primitive in an admin-facing view, leading to JavaScript execution in a privileged context.

mitigation: HTML-encode untrusted data before DOM insertion.
Adopt strict CSP and remove inline/event handlers.

reporter.title: CSV injection in export enables formula execution
reporter.summary: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.
steps_to_reproduce: Create a record with a field value beginning with a formula string.
Export CSV and open in Excel/LibreOffice; observe formula execution.

impact.description: CSV export writes unescaped values; cells starting with =,+,-,@ are treated as formulas by spreadsheet apps, enabling exfiltration when opened.

mitigation: Escape cells starting with =,+,-,@ by prefixing a space or apostrophe.
Offer XLSX format by default.
